answers.answer: Did you ever go on a course of antibiotics?  If you did, you may have a fungal overgrowth in your intestinal tract called Candida.  The white fluffy material in your stool is perhaps in indicator of this.  Good news, it is easily curable with proper diet, probiotics, water and exercise.
The only time I was ever on antibiotics was after the kidney stones back in november but I competed the cycle of them properly

question: hi i am a Caucasian twenty year old male in normally decent health. about three years ago i was around two hundred pounds and within six months i was down to 150. the weight loss was accompanied by nausea always followed by vomiting, dizziness, weakness, and severe abdominal pain. i had an endoscopy as well as various blood tests but no result was ever found, i also had a ct scan, was tested for diabetes and thryoid conditions all was negative. for about a year and a half or so i didn't lose any more weight but since then i have only gained about 15 pounds back, i always find myself hungry and seem to be eating entirely to much at meals but cannot seem to get full. a couple of months back i begin to have abdominal pain again and woke up one morning with crippling pain in my lower back and was found to have kidney stones.a couple of days ago i found a white what appeared to be fluffy string-like material attached to my stool, i was dismissed by so many doctors previously i am afraid to go back. on a different note for about the last six months or so i have been experiencing insomnia on almost a daily basis.any ideas would be much appreciated.
title: Various Problems, most recently kidney stones and white "fluffy" looking stuff in stool
